userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] James Otey Bradford Papers, M046, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHY
bioghist.p: James Otey Bradford (d 1919?] was born in Virginia and served as a lieutenant in the Confederate Navy. After the war he worked for various English shipping lines. He began his employ with Wells, Fargo in New York City. In this position he was in charge of freight and travel requests for tourists. He left Wells, Fargo and moved to San Francisco where he was employed by the Palace Hotel. He shortly returned to the employ of Wells, Fargo and remained with them until retirement. In his later years he served as the director of the Wells, Fargo historical exhibit at the Columbian Exhibition of 1893. Later he was placed in charge of all Wells, Fargo historical exhibits. He retired after forty years service with the company. Much of the present collection represents Mr. Bradford's interest in the history of Wells, Fargo.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: The Bradford papers contain James Otey Bradford's correspondence from 1888-1919. Much of it is correspondence pertaining to his duties with the Wells, Fargo & Co. There are also typescripts of historical writings (possibly copied from printed sources) and copies of newspaper articles pertaining to the early days of stage coaching, the men involved and the crimes committed against stages. Biographical material pertaining to stage robbers, as well as drivers are in the collection.
An important part of the collection are the numerous pictures of employees of Wells, Fargo and the coaches, as well as pictures of sailing vessels and related transportation media.
The papers of Henry Chester Ward, an early employee of the company are included in the collection. Among Ward's papers are his diary for a short period of 1869-1870.
Letters of J.O. Bradford arranged chronologically; 1888-1901. Letter to J. 0. Bradford arranged alphabetically by signer and chronologically under each signer, 1888-1919.
Wells, Fargo manuscripts. Typescripts of articles and unpublished reports, biographical sketches and reminiscences. Articles and poems probably by Bradford.
Memorabilia and personal papers of J. 0. Bradford.
Photographs of the men and equipment of Wells, Fargo.
Correspondence, diary, and last will and testament.

note.p: (A listing of the names to whom letters were sent has been prepared and placed in the front of books 1-4).

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of papers relating to Bradford's employment and achievements.

Memorandum book of [Golden Gate] Park Museum display. Memorandum book with notes about early express companies and mining communities. Catalogue... Wells, Fargo & Co., Historical Exhibit at the 1893 World's Columbian Exhibit. Catalogue of the Wells, Fargo exhibit at the Museum. Golden Gate Park.
Wells, Fargo business letters, mostly printed.
A. Lyman. Political letter to the editor of the National Democrat, March 9, 1891.
A Synopsis of status of Wells, Fargo to Aug. l, 1892.
Between Treasure City, Nevada and Hamilton in 1869.
Fortino Viscayno and his raid upon Guymas, Mexico.
H.C. Ward and his flight from Treasure City to Hamilton, Nevada.
Wells, Fargo and Co. express and banking.
Proclamation of Mayor E. E. Schmitz to prevent looting.
Two periodical articles pertaining to the Confederate Navy.
Photographs of Wells, Fargo employees, men and women, stage coaches, sailing vessels, and related scenes.
H.C. Ward letter-book, 1893-1895.Includes four stories in longhand about stage operations in California.
H.C. Ward diary, Nov. 17, 1869-Feb.9, 1870.Includes notes added at a later date.

note.p: The letters in these books are arranged chronologically on this list, not just according to page number. Unless otherwise noted, letters are from Bradford to the people named.

separatedmaterial.head: SEPARATED MATERIALS
separatedmaterial.p: Oversize glass negative of a print showing stage coach in Cal. mountains.
One scrap-book of newspaper clippings. Some are articles written by Bradford.
